AudioAttributesCompat.Builder().Description: Constructs a new Builder with the defaults. By default, usage and content type are respectively @B_android#support#v4#media#AudioAttributesCompat#USAGE_UNKNOWN_E@ and @B_android#support#v4#media#AudioAttributesCompat#CONTENT_TYPE_UNKNOWN_E@, and flags are 0. It is recommended to configure the usage (with @B_android#support#v4#media#AudioAttributesCompat#Builder#setUsage_E@) or deriving attributes from a legacy stream type (with @B_android#support#v4#media#AudioAttributesCompat#Builder#setLegacyStreamType_E@) before calling @B_android#support#v4#media#AudioAttributesCompat#Builder#build_E@ to override any default playback behavior in terms of routing and volume management.

setLegacyStreamType(int).Description: Create an @B_android#support#v4#media#AudioAttributesCompat_E@ that best approximates the specified @B_android#media#AudioManager_E@ stream type constant.

setUsage(int).Description: Sets the attribute describing what is the intended use of the the audio signal, such as alarm or ringtone.

Parameters: int: the content type values, one of @B_android#support#v4#media#AudioAttributesCompat#CONTENT_TYPE_MOVIE_E@, @B_android#support#v4#media#AudioAttributesCompat#CONTENT_TYPE_MUSIC_E@, @B_android#support#v4#media#AudioAttributesCompat#CONTENT_TYPE_SONIFICATION_E@, @B_android#support#v4#media#AudioAttributesCompat#CONTENT_TYPE_SPEECH_E@, @B_android#support#v4#media#AudioAttributesCompat#CONTENT_TYPE_UNKNOWN_E@.
setContentType(int).Description: Sets the attribute describing the content type of the audio signal, such as speech, or music.

build().Description: Combines all of the attributes that have been set and return a new @B_android#support#v4#media#AudioAttributesCompat_E@ object.

setFlags(int).Description: Sets the combination of flags. This is a bitwise OR with the existing flags.

ClassDesc: Builder class for @B_android#support#v4#media#AudioAttributesCompat_E@ objects. example: By default all types of information (usage, content type, flags) conveyed by an AudioAttributesCompat instance are set to "unknown". Unknown information will be interpreted as a default value that is dependent on the context of use, for instance a https:##developer#android#com@B_android#media#MediaPlayer_E@ will use a default usage of @B_android#support#v4#media#AudioAttributesCompat#USAGE_MEDIA_E@. See also https:##developer#android#com@B_android#media#AudioAttributes#Builder_E@.
